intro: Molinaea campylocarpa, commonly known as the woolly mole plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it its common name. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
